title: Table 1: % Children enrolled in different types of schools. By age group and sex. 2024
description: Comprehensive enrollment data for children in Tripura for the year 2024, categorized by age groups (6-16) and gender. The table details the percentage of students in Government, Private, and Other schools, as well as those not currently enrolled. It also includes longitudinal trends from 2006 to 2024 regarding out-of-school rates and government school enrollment.
data: | Age group and sex | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in school | Total |

title: Table 2: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2022
description: Enrollment distribution for children aged 3 to 8 years in Tripura for the year 2022. This table breaks down participation in pre-school institutions (Anganwadi, Government pre-primary, Private LKG/UKG) versus formal schooling (Government, Private), and includes the percentage of children not attending any institution.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Anganwadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 3: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2024
description: Updated enrollment statistics for children aged 3 to 8 years in Tripura for the year 2024. The table categorizes children into Anganwadis, government pre-primary, private pre-schools, and formal government/private schools, allowing for comparison of early childhood education trends against 2022 data.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Anganwadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/ UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 4: % Children by grade and reading level. All children. 2024
description: Foundational literacy assessment data for children in Tripura in 2024. The table displays the percentage of students in Grades I through VIII categorized by their highest reading proficiency level, ranging from 'Not even letter' to being able to read 'Standard II level text'.
data: | Std | Not even letter | Letter | Word | Std I level text | Std II level text | Total |

title: Table 5: Trends over time
description: Historical trend analysis (2014-2024) of reading proficiency for Standard III students in Tripura. The table tracks the percentage of children capable of reading Standard II level text, broken down by Government and Private school enrollment.
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text |

title: Table 6: Trends over time
description: Longitudinal reading performance data for students in Standard V and Standard VIII in Tripura from 2014 to 2024. It shows the percentage of students in these higher grades who can read basic Standard II level text, differentiating between government and private schools.

title: Table 7: % Children by grade and arithmetic level. All children. 2024
description: Foundational numeracy assessment results for Tripura in 2024. This table details the arithmetic proficiency of students in Grades I through VIII, classifying them by their highest capability: number recognition, subtraction, or division.

title: Table 8: Trends over time
description: Trends in basic arithmetic skills (subtraction) for Standard III students in Tripura from 2014 to 2024. The table displays the percentage of children who can perform at least subtraction, with a comparison between government and private schools.
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction |

title: Table 9: Trends over time
description: Historical data regarding division-level arithmetic skills for students in Standard V and Standard VIII in Tripura (2014-2024). The table shows the percentage of students able to solve division problems, broken down by school type.

title: Table 10: Smartphone availability and use. By age. 2024
description: Digital access statistics for adolescents aged 14 to 16 in Tripura for the year 2024. Metrics include the percentage of children with smartphones at home, their ability to use them for digital tasks, and the rate of personal smartphone ownership.
